intro: Serapias grandiflora subsp. ensifolia, commonly known as the swordleaf orchid, is a rare and specialized plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers with a unique hooded structure, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and requires specific microclimatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
